text: Hello, dummy!
Jon Reep here -- "The Well Readneck" --
reading books so you don't have to.
You know, it's like Cliff Notes
if Cliff drank moonshine and chewed tobacco.
Today we're looking at Jack Kerouac's "On The Road."
At first I thought this might be a prequel
to the iconic Willie Nelson song ♪ On The Road Again ♪
Remember that one?
It says this book is a search for the heart of America,
and it also says in here
"the best teacher is experience."
I think nowadays they just call them cougars.
Let's get into some quotes, shall we?
"We got to go and never stop going."
You know what?
Takes forever.
And Dean Moriarty gets a bunch of women pregnant in this book.
Ain't that that Japanese napkin-folding s---?
Make me a crane, Dean!
They do a bunch of drugs in this book, including weed,
which these beatniks call tea.
That's a little too confusing.
You're supposed to smoke the weed and drink the tea.
I mean, you might mess up and accidentally order
a quarter bag of tea and a pitcher of iced weed!
Ha!
Yeah. I swallow it sometimes.
Well, that's it for now.
Thanks for joining us here on "The Well Readneck."
Till next time...bicycle.
[ Spits ]
[ Classical music plays ]
